pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw:
CI doesn't like this:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none&build=105)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/105/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/105/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia&build=120)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia/120/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia/120/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64&build=1884)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1884/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1884/

there seems to be a problem compiling  the gazebo msgs generator

~~~
# ubuntu
gazebo/msgs/generator/GazeboGenerator.cc:52:5: error: ‘unique_ptr’ is not a member of ‘std’
     std::unique_ptr<io::ZeroCopyOutputStream> output(
     ^
~~~

~~~
# macOS brew
/usr/local/include/google/protobuf/stubs/port.h:114:2: error: "Protobuf requires at least C++11."
#error "Protobuf requires at least C++11."
 ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [gazebo/msgs/CMakeFiles/gazebomsgs_out.dir/generator/gazebo_generator.cc.o] Error 1
~~~
content.html:
CI doesn't like this:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-none/105/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64-gpu-nvidia/120/
  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/1884/

there seems to be a problem compiling the gazebo msgs generator

# ubuntu
gazebo/msgs/generator/GazeboGenerator.cc:52:5: error: ‘unique_ptr’ is not a member of ‘std’
     std::unique_ptr<io::ZeroCopyOutputStream> output(
     ^

# macOS brew
/usr/local/include/google/protobuf/stubs/port.h:114:2: error: "Protobuf requires at least C++11."
#error "Protobuf requires at least C++11."
 ^
1 error generated.
make[2]: *** [gazebo/msgs/CMakeFiles/gazebomsgs_out.dir/generator/gazebo_generator.cc.o] Error 1

pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw:
[https://bitbucket.org/jlee02/gazebo/commits/42a2868a67759586a2138eb373f5c0ab9cc2793e](https://bitbucket.org/jlee02/gazebo/commits/42a2868a67759586a2138eb373f5c0ab9cc2793e) should resolve the build error. Added the C\+\+ standard option to `gazebomsgs_out`.

https://bitbucket.org/jlee02/gazebo/commits/42a2868a67759586a2138eb373f5c0ab9cc2793e should resolve the build error. Added the C++ standard option to gazebomsgs_out.

pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard
Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw: should we leave `${UNFILTERED_FLAGS}` in place on this line so that it will still add `"/EHsc"` from line 263? if the `UNFILTERED_FLAGS` variable will no longer be used, should we delete the code at line 263?
content.html: should we leave ${UNFILTERED_FLAGS} in place on this line so that it will still add "/EHsc" from line 263? if the UNFILTERED_FLAGS variable will no longer be used, should we delete the code at line 263?

pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw: I didn’t catch that `UNFILTERED_FLAGS` was used other than setting `-std=c++11`. Keeping `UNFILTERED_FLAGS` makes sense to me for the code at line 263 and more potential flags in the future.
content.html: I didn’t catch that UNFILTERED_FLAGS was used other than setting -std=c++11. Keeping UNFILTERED_FLAGS makes sense to me for the code at line 263 and more potential flags in the future.

pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard
Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw: What about [#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in#lines-131](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in#lines-131) and [#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/pkgconfig/gazebo.in#lines-10](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/pkgconfig/gazebo.in#lines-10)? Shouldn’t these also remove the `std=c++11` flag?
content.html: What about #!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/gazebo-config.cmake.in#lines-131 and #!/osrf/gazebo/src/c126bbd5a3e7aca7535b783fa796daf5dfe0f35d/cmake/pkgconfig/gazebo.in#lines-10? Shouldn’t these also remove the std=c++11 flag?

pullrequest.title: Use target based compile options to specify C++ standard

content.raw: [This post](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/issues/19917#note_647975) actually suggests to add `cxx_std_11` to public `target_compile_features` instead of passing the compiler flag. [With CMake 3.15\+](https://gitlab.kitware.com/cmake/cmake/-/merge_requests/3023), it will result in adding no flags when using a C\+\+11-compatible compiler. But CMake 3.14- \(e.g. 3.10 used in Bionic\) will still pass the `-std=c++1` flag :disappointed:
content.html: This post actually suggests to add cxx_std_11 to public target_compile_features instead of passing the compiler flag. With CMake 3.15+, it will result in adding no flags when using a C++11-compatible compiler. But CMake 3.14- (e.g. 3.10 used in Bionic) will still pass the -std=c++1 flag
